notes: First-time homebuyers, both teachers in their early 30s. Have been saving for 5 years and are pre-approved for $480k. Looking for a starter home to raise a family. Currently renting a 2-bedroom apartment but expecting their first child in 6 months. Very concerned about school districts - want to be in the Westside Elementary zone. Would prefer a single-family home with a yard for kids to play. Budget is tight but flexible if perfect property comes along. Both work full-time but have stable incomes. No major debt except student loans. Want to move before baby arrives.

Software engineer looking for investment property. Has significant cash reserves and wants to get into real estate investing. Already owns primary residence. Looking for multi-family properties or condos in up-and-coming neighborhoods that he can rent out. Wants positive cash flow from day one. Very analytical - wants to see rental comps, neighborhood growth data, and ROI projections for any property. Not concerned about move-in ready condition as he's handy with renovations. Prefers properties near tech companies or universities for reliable renters.

Empty nesters looking to downsize from their 4-bedroom family home. Kids are in college and they want something easier to maintain. Currently in suburbs but interested in moving closer to downtown for cultural activities and restaurants. Want luxury finishes and low maintenance. Budget is flexible as they'll get significant equity from selling current home (estimated $800k). Looking for condos or townhomes with amenities like gym, pool, concierge. Must have 2 bedrooms for when kids visit and home office space since David works remotely.

Single professional, nurse at Children's Hospital. Looking for her first home after years of apartment living. Wants something modern and move-in ready as she works long shifts and doesn't have time for renovations. Interested in townhomes or condos with garage parking for her car. Must be pet-friendly as she has two cats. Prefers newer construction with energy efficient features. Budget is conservative as she wants to maintain emergency fund. Showed her 3 properties today - loved the Maple Street townhome but concerned about HOA fees.

Young couple, both software developers at major tech companies. Looking for their first home together after getting married last year. Want to be strategic about their purchase as they may relocate for work in 3-5 years. Interested in areas with good resale value. Both have high incomes but also high student loan payments. Pre-approved but want to stay well under their max to maintain savings rate. Looking for 3-bedroom home in family-friendly neighborhood even though no kids yet. Want good schools for future and resale value.

Divorced mother of two teenagers looking to buy a home in their current school district so kids don't have to change schools. Has been renting since divorce was finalized 2 years ago and ready to build equity again. Budget is limited due to single income but receives child support. Must stay in Lincoln High School zone for her son who's a senior. Needs at least 3 bedrooms so kids can have their own rooms. Very motivated to make an offer on the Oak Street property we showed last week. Concerned about inspection items but willing to negotiate.

Retired couple looking to relocate from the East Coast to be closer to grandchildren. Want a smaller home that's easy to maintain but still has space for family visits. Health considerations important - prefer single level living or master on main floor. Budget is comfortable from retirement savings and sale of previous home. Interested in active adult communities or quiet neighborhoods. Want to be within 30 minutes of their daughter's family. Not in a rush as they're researching the area thoroughly first.

mustHaves: single level or master on main

notes: Contractor who flips houses looking for next project. Has cash available and moves quickly on good deals. Specializes in older homes that need complete renovation. Not interested in move-in ready properties - wants something with problems that scares away other buyers. Excellent at estimating renovation costs and timeline. Has crew ready to start immediately. Looking for properties under market value that can be transformed and sold for profit. Prefers traditional neighborhoods with good bones.

Growing family with 3 young children (ages 2, 5, 7) outgrowing their current 3-bedroom home. Need more space and better layout. Both parents work from home part-time so need dedicated office spaces. Kids are active and need large yard for playing. Must be in top-rated school district. Want quiet street with other families. Showed them the Elmwood property - loved the layout and yard but concerned about the price. Need to sell current home first but have backup cash from family if needed.

dealBreakers: open floor plan unsuitable for WFH

notes: Marketing executive relocating for new job. Company is providing relocation assistance and temporary housing for 3 months. Needs to find permanent housing quickly. Single, no kids, but has elderly mother who may move in later so wants flexible space. Interested in modern condos or townhomes with amenities. Values walkability and proximity to restaurants, shopping, entertainment. Budget is generous due to salary increase with new position. Wants luxury finishes and high-end appliances.

Local business owners (restaurant) looking for commercial-residential property. Want to live above or adjacent to their business expansion. Interested in mixed-use properties or areas zoned for commercial use. Have specific needs due to restaurant business - need parking for customers, appropriate zoning, and living space that's separate from business noise. Ready to make cash offer on right property. Looking at the Main Street building that has retail downstairs and apartment upstairs.

Recently divorced, splitting assets with ex-spouse. Has teenage daughter who stays with him every other week. Needs 2-bedroom place in good school district but doesn't want to overspend during transitional period. Currently staying with brother but needs own place soon. Credit is good but income is lower than before due to alimony payments. Looking for value properties that might need cosmetic work. Handy with repairs and has time to do improvements. Wants to rebuild financial stability.

First-generation home buyer, works two jobs (day job in administration, evening job as translator). Has been saving diligently for down payment. Family is very important - wants to be near her parents and siblings who live in the Hispanic community area. Needs help understanding all aspects of home buying process. Pre-approved through first-time buyer program with down payment assistance. Looking for solid starter home that won't require immediate major repairs. Very cost-conscious but also wants safe neighborhood for her and her young son.

Pediatrician finishing residency and starting private practice. High income potential but currently has significant student loans. Looking for home that reflects professional status but also practical for her lifestyle. Works long hours so wants low maintenance. No kids yet but planning family in next few years. Wants home office space for telehealth calls. Interested in prestigious neighborhoods with other professionals. Has family money available for larger down payment to reduce monthly payments.

Elderly couple looking to sell large family home and buy two smaller properties - one for them and one for their adult disabled son who currently lives with them. Want to maintain independence while staying close to provide care. Son needs accessible features and they want him in same neighborhood. They need single-level homes or homes with bedroom/bathroom on main floor. Timeline is flexible but want to coordinate both purchases with their home sale. Estate planning is important consideration.

mustHaves: single level or main floor master

notes: Startup founder in tech company that just received Series A funding. Income is variable but has significant equity and cash from recent funding round. Looking for modern home that can serve as occasional meeting space for small team. Wants smart home technology and high-end finishes. No kids, lifestyle focused on work and entertaining. Interested in trendy neighborhoods near other young professionals. Budget is flexible - more concerned about finding right property than staying within specific range.

Military family being transferred to the area. Need to find housing quickly before husband's deployment. Wife will be managing household and kids alone for 8 months so wants safe neighborhood with good community support. Have VA loan pre-approval. Looking for home in established family neighborhood with good schools and military family-friendly amenities. Kids are ages 8 and 12. Ready to make competitive offer on houses that meet their needs - not looking for perfect, just functional and safe.

Widower whose wife passed away 2 years ago. Adult children think he should downsize from family home but he's not ready emotionally. Looking for smaller place but still wants to feel like 'home.' Needs main floor bedroom and bathroom due to mobility issues. Budget is not a concern due to life insurance and investments. Wants to stay in same general area where he's lived for 30 years. Emotional attachment to neighborhood and community connections. Took long time to be ready for this step.

Financial advisor who understands real estate as investment. Looking for property that will appreciate well over time. Wants to buy in emerging neighborhood before prices rise significantly. Willing to do moderate renovations to add value. No kids yet but planning for future family. Wants good bones and character over move-in ready condition. Has done extensive market research and knows comparable sales. Very analytical about purchase decision and ROI projections.

Blended family with 5 kids between them (ages 6-16). Need large home to accommodate everyone. Both previously owned homes so understand process but this is more complex purchase due to family size. Need at least 4 bedrooms, preferably 5-6. Kids include different ages and needs - some need quiet study space, others need play areas. Budget is stretched due to supporting large family but both have good incomes. Must be in good school district. Looking at larger older homes that might need updates.
